properties.areaDesc: South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; White Pine County; Northeastern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Northwestern Nye County; Southeastern Elko County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 1:34AM PST until February 3 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected with the passage of a strong cold front
later Sunday afternoon and evening. Total snow accumulations
of 1 to 4 inches expected in valleys with 6 to locally up to
12 inches possible in the mountains of eastern White Pine
County. Wind gusts of 40 up to 55 mph possible along and
especially behind the front Sunday night into Monday.

* WHERE...Portions of north central, northeast and south central
Nevada.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of heavier snow showers and gusty
winds will accompany the passage of a strong cold front which
could produce one to four inches of snowfall along with areas
of blowing snow and reduced visibilities. Slippery road
conditions are expected to develop Sunday evening as
temperatures fall below freezing.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means adverse winter conditions will
impact road and air travel. Expect limited visibilities at times
with roads becoming snow covered and slippery, especially in
higher elevation summit and pass areas Sunday night.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST MONDAY
